summary: This document is an email chain from November 2020 among U.S. Attorney's Office (SDNY) staff coordinating the privilege review and release of data extracted from Jeffrey Epstein's electronic devices (phones and iPads). It details the process of removing potentially privileged materials and preparing responsive documents for a discovery deadline.

persons.name: Enrique
persons.context: Mentioned as generating NP reports for devices 1869 and 1884 and handling technical aspects of data transfer.

persons.name: Darren Indyke
persons.context: Mentioned in the context of a potentially privileged chat that was removed from device 1884.

persons.name: Reggie
persons.context: Generated reports the previous week that were undergoing responsiveness review.

persons.name: Lisa Korologos
persons.context: CC'd on emails, provided her mailing address for receiving a copied drive of Epstein device data.

persons.name: Maurene
persons.context: Initiated the request for help with the Epstein privilege review and coordinated the logistics of data copying and transfer.

persons.name: Sunny
persons.context: New staff member welcomed to the unit and tasked with copying and mailing the drive containing Epstein device data.

connections.description: Maurene assigns Sunny the task of copying and mailing the drive containing Epstein device data.
They coordinate on the logistics of the privilege review, with Lisa providing her address to receive the data.
A chat with Darren Indyke was found on Epstein's device and flagged as potentially privileged, indicating a legal relationship.

events.title: Release of Epstein Device Data
events.description: Multiple devices (e.g., 1872, 1883, 1869, 1884) had data released for privilege review, with specific counts of emails and chats provided after removal of potentially privileged materials.

events.title: Discovery Deadline
events.description: The case team was working towards a tight discovery deadline, requiring responsiveness review to be completed by November 5, 2020, to allow paralegals time to prepare materials.

events.title: Assignment of Privilege Review Task
events.description: Maurene emailed Sunny to welcome them and assign the task of copying and mailing a drive containing data from Epstein's phones and iPads.

locations: U.S. Attorney's Office, SDNY (Southern District of New York)
keyFacts: The document details an active privilege review process in November 2020 for data extracted from Jeffrey Epstein's electronic devices (phones/iPads).
Specific device IDs are referenced (e.g., 1872, 1883, 1869, 1884), with precise counts of emails and chats released after removal of potentially privileged materials.
A chat with attorney Darren Indyke was identified as potentially privileged and removed from device 1884.
The review was under a tight court-ordered discovery deadline, with a need to complete responsiveness review by November 5, 2020, for a November 9, 2020 production deadline.
The email chain shows logistical coordination between attorneys, paralegals, and IT staff within the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York.
